channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- User Registration
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- User Registration

item.title: CVE-2022-3912|2024-08-03T01:20:58.758Z -- unknown -- user%20registration
item.description: The User Registration WordPress plugin before 2.2.4.1 does not properly restrict the files to be uploaded via an AJAX action available to both unauthenticated and authenticated users, which could allow unauthenticated users to upload PHP files for example.

item.title: CVE-2024-1290|2024-06-24T14:58:54.267Z -- unknown -- user%20registration
item.description: The User Registration WordPress plugin before 2.12 does not prevent users with at least the contributor role from rendering sensitive shortcodes, allowing them to generate, and leak, valid password reset URLs, which they can use to take over any accounts.

item.title: CVE-2024-1290|2024-03-11T18:08:58.060Z -- unknown -- user%20registration
item.description: The User Registration WordPress plugin before 2.12 does not prevent users with at least the contributor role from rendering sensitive shortcodes, allowing them to generate, and leak, valid password reset URLs, which they can use to take over any accounts.

item.title: CVE-2024-1290|2024-08-01T18:33:25.378Z -- unknown -- user%20registration
item.description: The User Registration WordPress plugin before 2.12 does not prevent users with at least the contributor role from rendering sensitive shortcodes, allowing them to generate, and leak, valid password reset URLs, which they can use to take over any accounts.
